item.title: Install Storops RPM on RHEL7
item.description: Install a RHEL VM. If using qcow2 image, the default user is cloud-user. Use the OpenStack ssh key to login. Create a new user stack with password welcome. 1 2 3 $ sudo useradd stack $ sudo passwd stack $ sudo visudo Modify /etc/ssh/sshd_config to allow login via password Entry name is PasswordAuthentication. Register subscription 1 2 3 4 5 6 7 $ sudo subscription-manager register $ sudo subscription-manager attach --auto $ sudo subscription-manager repos \ --enable=rhel-7-server-rpms --enable=rhel-7-server-extras-rpms \ --enable=rhel-7-server-rh-common-rpms \ --enable=rhel-ha-for-rhel-7-server-rpms $ sudo yum update Download storops rpm from github 1 curl -OJL https://github.

item.title: Package Storops RPM on RHEL
item.description: Install a RHEL VM. If using qcow2 image, the default user is cloud-user. Use the OpenStack ssh key to login. Create a new user stack with password welcome. 1 2 3 $ sudo stack $ sudo passwd stack $ sudo visudo Register subscription 1 2 $ sudo subscription-manager register $ sudo subscription-manager attach --auto Install the basic packages like rpm-build 1 $ sudo yum install -y rpm-build git wget python-pip NOTE: need to upgrade the setuptools using pip.
